posts.title: Getting Started with Next.js
posts.excerpt: Learn how to build modern web applications with Next.js, a React framework.
posts.content:
Next.js is a React framework that enables several extra features, including server-side rendering and generating static websites.

Next.js provides a solution to all of React's major limitations by handling the tooling and configuration needed for React, and adding additional features that optimize your application.

Why Next.js?

Here are some of the reasons why you might want to use Next.js for your next project:

  • Server-side rendering
  • Static site generation
  • Automatic code splitting
  • Client-side routing
  • API routes
  • Built-in CSS and Sass support

posts.title: Internationalization in Next.js
posts.excerpt: Learn how to implement internationalization in your Next.js application.
posts.content:
Internationalization (i18n) is the process of designing and preparing your app for different languages and regions. Next.js has built-in support for internationalized routing and language detection.

Setting up i18n in Next.js

To set up internationalization in Next.js, you need to:

  1. Define the supported languages
  2. Create a middleware to handle language detection and routing
  3. Organize your content in language-specific dictionaries
  4. Create a language switcher component

With these steps, you can create a fully internationalized Next.js application that supports multiple languages and regions.

posts.title: Using shadcn/ui with Next.js
posts.excerpt: Learn how to use shadcn/ui to build beautiful user interfaces in Next.js.
posts.content:
shadcn/ui is a collection of reusable components built using Radix UI and Tailwind CSS. It's not a component library, but rather a collection of re-usable components that you can copy and paste into your apps.

Getting Started with shadcn/ui

To use shadcn/ui in your Next.js project:

  1. Set up Tailwind CSS in your project
  2. Add the necessary dependencies
  3. Configure your project to use shadcn/ui
  4. Start adding components to your project

shadcn/ui provides a great starting point for building beautiful, accessible user interfaces in your Next.js applications.
